00027 #ifndef _KCHE_TREE_VECTOR_H_

00030 namespace kche_tree {

00044 template <typename T, const unsigned int D>
00045 struct Vector {
00046 
00048   T data[D];
00049 
00050   // Constructors.
00051   Vector() {} 
00052 
00053   // Subscript operators.
00054   const T & operator [] (unsigned int index) const { return data[index]; } 
00055   T & operator [] (unsigned int index) { return data[index]; } 
00056 
00057   // Comparison operators.
00058   bool operator == (const Vector &p) const; 
00059   bool operator != (const Vector &p) const; 
00060 
00061   // Squared distance operators for two D-dimensional points of type T.
00062   inline T distance_to(const Vector &p) const; 
00063   inline T distance_to(const Vector &p, T upper_bound) const; 
00064 
00065   // Memory operators: used to allow memory-aligned specializations. For example, for SSE optimizations.
00066   void *operator new [] (size_t size); 
00067   void  operator delete [] (void *p); 
00068 
00069 }
00070 ;
00071 
00079 template <typename T>
00080 struct VectorDistance : public std::binary_function <VectorDistance<T>, VectorDistance<T>, bool> {
00081 
00082   unsigned int index; 
00083   T squared_distance; 
00084 
00085   // Default and convenience constructors.
00086   VectorDistance() {}
00087   VectorDistance(unsigned int index, T squared_distance) : index(index), squared_distance(squared_distance) {}
00088 
00090   bool operator () (const VectorDistance &v1, const VectorDistance &v2) const {
00091     return v1.squared_distance < v2.squared_distance;
00092   }
00093 };
00094 
00095 } // namespace kche_tree
